user.biography: DC Hillier, Writer & Designer based in Montréal 🇨🇦 Author of Mid Century Modern at Home available on amazon.com. DM for collab.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by MCM Daily on August 19, 2021. May be an image of nature.

node.text: Montréal, summer of 1967 - Expo 67. In the foreground the pavilion of the Soviet Union designed by architect Mikhail Posokhin and in the background the geodesic dome (largest built at the time) of the USA pavilion designed by Buckminster Fuller and Shoji Sadao. Both were the most visited pavilions at Expo 67 with the US edging out the USSR with over 50 million visits. Both are also still around with the US pavilion now a museum dedicated to environmental issues and the Soviet building was dismantled and reassembled in Moscow where it a convention/exhibition building. Photos: Antoine Desilets / Archives de Montréal / Archives of Canada / Denis Esakov #mcmdaily #buckminsterfuller #shojisadao #mikhailposokhin #expo67 #montreal #russia🇷🇺 #usa🇺🇸 #canada🇨🇦 mcmdaily.com

node.text: One of my favorite pieces with the model FD 523 ‘Pinwheel’ coffee table designed by Peter Hvidt and Orla Mølgaard-Nielsen. Made from teak, with brass detail, it was made in Denmark in 1952. Photos: @morentz_gallery #mcmdaily #peterhvidt #orlamølgaardnielsen #denmark🇩🇰 mcmdaily.com

node.text: Shared from @annmarisauctions (lovely items - well worth following!) A set of Model 9019 ‘Nikke’ chairs designed by Tapio Wirkkala. Made from steel and ‘rythmic’  pattern birch and teak veneer they were produced by Asko of Finland 1958. #mcmdaily #tapiowirkkala #nikkechair #nordicmodernism #finland🇫🇮 mcmdaily.com

node.text: Perched on a hillside overlooking the Potomac River the Luis & Ethel Marden House. Located in McLean, Virginia the 3000 square ft / 279 m2 Usonian home was designed by Frank Lloyd Wright in 1952 (built in 1959) and was fully restored by Richard Williams Architects in 2011. Photos: Nikolas Koenig / Sothebys Realty / richardwilliamsarchitects.com / William Stoner #mcmdaily #franklloydwright #usonian #usa🇺🇸 mcmdaily.com

node.text: As many of you may know I find and restore the Clairtone Project G and G2 stereos, many of which I’ve moved onto new homes. I thought I’d share a bit of history of the Project G. In 1963 the co-founders of the Canadian company Clairtone, Peter Munk and David Gilmour, were looking to create something entirely new in home stereo. Designed by Hugh Spencer the rosewood and aluminum  Project G was launched in April of 1964. It was an immediate sensation in the media and soon found its way into fashion shoots, movies, and TV with many celebrity endorsements. And while it was a great sounding and innovative stereo it never found a solid market. Costing nearly 2000 dollars when launched most consumers found the price prohibitive and the production run ended three years later in 1967. Just under 400 Project G stereos were made. Many went unsold and returned to the factory. Today, by my accounting, there are about 50 still around and they are a very desirable item to collectors. Photos: George Whiteside / Warner Brothers Archive / @dc_hillier / The Design Exchange / Steve Herman  #mcmdaily #clairtone #clairtoneprojectg #projectgstereo #vintageaudiogear #canada🇨🇦 mcmdaily.com

node.text: A ETR coffee table - nicknamed the ‘surfboard’ - designed by Charles and Ray Eames for Herman Miller in 1951. Shown here being loaded into a 1959 Austin Healey. 🙂 Photo: @eamesoffice #mcmdaily #charlesandrayeames #eames #hermanmiller #austinhealey #usa🇺🇸 mcmdaily.com

node.text: Located in the town of Flaine in the French Alps the Flaine Ski Resort, a massive ski town designed by architect Marcel Breuer in the Béton Brut style in 1960 and completed in 1968. Photos: Alastair Philip Wiper / Phaidon #mcmdaily #marcelbreuer #flaineskiresort #bétonbrut #usa🇺🇸 #france🇫🇷 mcmdaily.com

node.text: Classic American Modern with this waterfront rambler located in St. Michaels, Maryland. Built in 1958 (could not find info on the architect) the home had fallen into a desperate state of disrepair but was renovated and restored by the firm of Wiedemann Architects, with interiors by Shaun Jackson. Photos: Anice Hoachlander #mcmdaily #mcmrambler #mcmranchhouse #usa🇺🇸 mcmdaily.com

node.text: Shared from @annmarisauctions (lovely items - well worth following!) A lovely ceiling light designed by Paavo Tynell.
